intro: Pedicularis caucasica var. albiflora, commonly known as the Caucasian white-lipped orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique floral display.
